cluster_relations.rel_desc: Stories depict predatory strangers as part of their narrative content.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Predatory Strangers in Cautionary Urban Legends

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Stories depict children as vulnerable characters in the narrative.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Child Victims in Cautionary Urban Legends

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Stories include cursed objects as central motifs.
Stories describe haunted houses characterized by dark pasts.
remarks: Haunted houses themselves are not separate entities in this chunk; relation focuses on dark pasts as the represented aspect.

args.canonical_rel_desc: The subject narrative portrays, includes, or represents the object as part of its narrative content (e.g., characters, threats, cursed items, or backstories).
args.justification: All four relations link 'stories' to elements that appear within their narrative content (predatory strangers, vulnerable children, cursed objects, dark pasts), with rel_hint_type='content' and similar descriptions using 'depicts' or 'include'. They share the same representational predicate: the story depicts/represents the referenced entity or concept.

Each relation connects a narrative (story/urban legend) to an element that is represented within it, such as characters, threats, objects, or backstories. This is best modeled as a common class of narrative depiction/content relations, independent of the specific type of depicted element.

The relations describe how stories represent or portray certain entities and concepts in their content. This is about representational content, not physical composition, causality, or hierarchy, so a broad group for representation/depiction is appropriate.
